clumpy.definition.Case¶

class clumpy.definition.Case(params, region=None, verbose=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

A land use and cover change model case.

Parameters

params (dict) – parameters, see example and user guide.

Methods

make(initial_luc_layer[, final_luc_layer, …])

Make the case
make(initial_luc_layer, final_luc_layer=None, region=None, explanatory_variables=True)[source]¶

Make the case

Parameters

  • initial_luc_layer (clumpy.definition.LandUseCoverLayer) – The initial LUC layer.

  • final_luc_layer (clumpy.definition.LandUseCoverLayer, default=None) – The final LUC layer. This parameter is optional.

Returns

  • X_u (dict of numpy.ndarray of shape (n_samples, n_features)) – A dict with \(u\) keys. Each dict values are features data, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

  • (v_u) (dict of numpy.ndarray of shape (n_samples,)) – Returned if final_luc_layer is provided. A dict with \(u\) keys. Each dict values are target values, i.e. \(v\), where n_samples is the number of samples.

Examples

params = {3:{'v':[2,7],
             'features':[('layer',dem),
                         ('distance',2),
                         ('distance',7)]
             },
          4:{'v':[2,3],
             'features':[('layer',dem),
                         ('distance',2),
                         ('distance',3)]}
          }
case = clumpy.definition.Case(params)
X_u, v_u = case.make(LUC1998, LUC2003)
